Quick transfers and convenient storage of documents, music, videos and more.

body.description: Kingston’s DataTraveler Exodia features USB 3.2 Gen 1 performance for easy access to laptops, desktop PCs, monitors and other digital devices. DT Exodia allows quick transfers and convenient storage of documents, music, videos and more. Its practical design and fashionable colors make it ideal for everyday use at work, home, school or wherever you need to take your data. free technical support and legendary Kingston reliability.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.6 4.6 out of 5 stars 44,762 ratings 4.6 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Kingston Easy access and quick transfers everyday
Ultimate portability DT Exodia features a large, colorful loop that easily attaches to key rings, enabling you to have extra storage on the go
Cap protection Practical cap protects the USB plug and your data. The cap also fits onto the back loop, so you won’t miss it.
Backward Compatibility Compatible with existing USB 2.0 ports, allowing 2.0 users to migrate to 3.0 in the future without replacing their drives.
Capacities Storage capacities range from 32GB to 256GB.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable and Fast Storage Solution
reviews.reviewText: Awesome speed high-Speed Transfers:The USB 3.2 support ensures rapid data transfers. I experienced quick file transfers and efficient loading times, making it ideal for both small and large files.Generous Storage Capacity:With 64GB of storage space, the Exodia provides ample room for documents, photos, videos, and more. It's a great choice for carrying important files on the go.Sturdy Build Quality:The build quality is excellent. The flash drive feels durable and well-constructed. The design is simple and practical, with a cap that securely protects the USB connector.Plug-and-Play Convenience:The plug-and-play functionality makes it incredibly easy to use. It works seamlessly across various devices, including computers, laptops, and even some smart TVs, without the need for additional drivers.Reliable Brand:Kingston has a reputation for producing high-quality storage solutions, and the DataTraveler Exodia lives up to that standard. I trust Kingston for reliable and durable storage devices.Affordable Price:Considering the performance and storage capacity, the Kingston DataTraveler Exodia offers great value for its price. It competes well with other flash drives in the same price range.In conclusion, the Kingston DataTraveler Exodia 64GB USB 3.2 Flash Drive is a reliable and efficient storage solution for anyone in need of a portable drive. Whether you're a student, professional, or casual user, this flash drive delivers on performance and durability. I'm pleased with my purchase and would recommend it to others in search of a dependable USB drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable USB thumb drive
reviews.reviewText: This drive is very reliable and works well, it comes with two which is nice having a spare. I've had mine for 6 months as of writing this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Flash Drive - Real Deal - Not Fake
reviews.reviewText: I bought this Kingston 64GB flash drive to transfer large files. I tested it in Linux and everything checked out fine. Average read speed is ~ 100 MB/Sec. Average write speed is ~ 20 MB/Sec. I was using it on USB 3 port on my computer. This drive is definitely real. I have a Kingston 4GB flash drive I've used for about 20 years. It has been reformatted probably 1000 times or more and has also been accidentally washed in my pants several times. It has outlasted several other brands of flash drives. I can only hope this 64GB drive can perform as well as the older Kingston flash drive. Buy it. I believe you will be happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Slow write time, but good enough for storage.
reviews.reviewText: I got one of the 256Gs to make a usb boot drive. For that it worked perfectly, I was able to fix this PC with youtube videos and a few downloads after a hard drive crash booting direct from the USB. Then I got one for photos and things, but wanted to test it's read write in a real world stress test. I downloaded 108.5Gbs over ethernet (GTAV from steam), it took roughly a day and a half to download. It's write takes a while. I was surprised it ran at all but I did play half the first mission until it struggled with rendering distant objects. No lag or pop in, just weird blocks in the distance. Amazed it ran at all. I am now moving the local files to a 2TB seagate and it's about 25% transferred after an hour. The download graph looked like a sawtooth, like it was getting a bunch of data but taking a moment to process it so there is defiantly a write bottle neck. For audio, photos, pdfs, and all those small files that add up fast this is fine, but if you transfer large data a lot it's slow. I knocked a star off for the write speed, but it's not bad to have horribly slow Tx for the price. If the it's my PC and the new seagate has the same issues I'll update.Update: Didn't have the driver installed for my video card, the Seagate did the same thing until I installed them so there is a chance I could have run GTA using this if the driver was installed. The write time was still crazy. It only took about 2 hours to move the 108Gs from this drive to the Seagate so it also may have been comcast throttling my download speeds. For the price you can't go wrong with this for backup though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does its Job
reviews.reviewText: For someone who likes computer projects and needed a back-up for a few documents, these are great to have around when needed. Since I don't use them very often, I don't care about transfer speeds.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023

reviews.reviewText: Es un buen producto por el precio pagado

reviews.reviewTitle: Budget Drive that does the Job!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this drive as a backup, and I must say, for the price point, I'm happy! Speeds are a tad slow, but that's to be expected. Everything works as it should.
Cumpre com o que diz, vem com 32gb, e parece resistente, até agora funcionando normal, além de ser bem bonito.
O pen drive é muito bom, consegui armazenar uma série de arquivos
